intro: Zornia pardina var. pardina, commonly known as the pink zornia, is a flowering plant native to parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. Its root system is well-developed, allowing it to thrive in sandy or well-drained soils. Zornia pardina var. pardina is often found in open habitats such as prairies and disturbed areas.
